description: Priority definition planning consists of the process of determining the set of Key Intelligence Topics (KIT) or Key Intelligence Questions (KIQ) required for meeting key strategic, operational, or tactical goals. Leadership outlines the priority definition (may be considered a goal) around which the adversary designs target selection and a plan to achieve. An analyst may outline the priority definition when in the course of determining gaps in existing KITs or KIQs.
name: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATT&CK Matrix - Priority Definition Planning

values.description: Analysts assess current information available against requirements that outline needs and wants as part of the research baselining process to begin satisfying a requirement.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1236 Assess current holdings, needs, and wants

values.description: Key Intelligence Topics (KITs) and Key Intelligence Questions (KIQs) may be further subdivided to focus on political, economic, diplomatic, military, financial, or intellectual property categories. An adversary may specify KITs or KIQs in this manner in order to understand how the information they are pursuing can have multiple uses and to consider all aspects of the types of information they need to target for a particular purpose. KIT.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1229 Assess KITs OR KIQs benefits

values.description: Leadership assesses the areas of most interest to them and generates Key Intelligence Topics (KIT) or Key Intelligence Questions (KIQ). For example, an adversary knows from open and closed source reporting that cyber is of interest, resulting in it being a KIT.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1224 Assess leadership areas of interest

values.description: Leadership organizes Key Intelligence Topics (KITs) and Key Intelligence Questions (KIQs) into three types of categories and creates more if necessary. An example of a description of key players KIT would be when an adversary assesses the cyber defensive capabilities of a nation-state threat actor.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1228 Assign KITs OR KIQs into categories

values.description: Leadership conducts a cost-benefit analysis that generates a compelling need for information gathering which triggers a Key Intelligence Toptic (KIT) or Key Intelligence Question (KIQ). For example, an adversary compares the cost of cyber intrusions with the expected benefits from increased intelligence collection on cyber adversaries.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1226 Conduct cost-benefit analysis

values.description: Implementation plans specify how the goals of the strategic plan will be executed.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1232 Create implementation plan

values.description: Strategic plans outline the mission, vision, and goals for an adversary at a high level in relation to the key partners, topics, and functions the adversary carries out.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1231 Create strategic plan

values.description: Leadership or key decision makers may derive specific intelligence requirements from Key Intelligence Topics (KITs) or Key Intelligence Questions (KIQs). Specific intelligence requirements assist analysts in gathering information to establish a baseline of information about a topic or question and collection managers to clarify the types of information that should be collected to satisfy the requirement.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1230 Derive intelligence requirements

values.description: Leadership derives Key Intelligence Topics (KITs) and Key Intelligence Questions (KIQs) from the areas of most interest to them. KITs are an expression of management's intelligence needs with respect to early warning, strategic and operational decisions, knowing the competition, and understanding the competitive situation. KIQs are the critical questions aligned by KIT which provide the basis for collection plans, create a context for analytic work, and (or) identify necessary external operations.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1227 Develop KITs OR KIQs

values.description: Analysts may receive Key Intelligence Topics (KITs) and Key Intelligence Questions (KIQs) from leadership or key decision makers and generate intelligence requirements to articulate intricacies of information required on a topic or question.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1234 Generate analyst intelligence requirements

values.description: Leadership identifies gap areas that generate a compelling need to generate a Key Intelligence Topic (KIT) or Key Intelligence Question (KIQ).
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1225 Identify gap areas

values.description: Analysts may receive intelligence requirements from leadership and begin research process to satisfy a requirement. Part of this process may include delineating between needs and wants and thinking through all the possible aspects associating with satisfying a requirement.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1235 Receive operator KITs OR KIQs tasking

values.description: Analysts identify gap areas that generate a compelling need to generate a Key Intelligence Topic (KIT) or Key Intelligence Question (KIQ).
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Priority Definition Planning: T1233 Identify analyst level gaps
